Articles.Content: :hailprobe:

I once made a probe named the Flying Lemur.

No idea why.

:hailprobe:

Well, I didn't want to *just* post :hailprobe:, now did I?
Hail probe!

Sometimes, though - like with Phobos Grunt - you might end up with probe hail instead.

Edited November 18, 2014 by Felsmak
:hailprobe:
:hailprobe:

Hail probe!

That is so cool.
:tovarisch comrade probe:

What exactly does :hailprobe: mean?

It used to invoke this smilie:

But sadly no longer does, and I'm told there are technical reasons why it won't be coming back any time soon. Still, we honor the probe in the hope that it might someday return and reward us for keeping the faith so piously.

:hailprobe:

It used to invoke this smilie:

http://www.orbiterwiki.org/images/7/79/Hailprobev2.gif

But sadly no longer does, and I'm told there are technical reasons why it won't be coming back any time soon. Still, we honor the probe in the hope that it might someday return and reward us for keeping the faith so piously.

:hailprobe:

:hailprobe:
:hailprobe:
:hailprobe:

All hail the probe. :hailprobe:

This thread needs to be gone. Why would one care for a probe from a out-to-date mod? Doing such an act is nonsensical and annoying, as if a troll came and swung its fur-tipped tail all over your monitor, damaging it beyond repair.

This, my friends on the internet, proves that the community of KSP has gone down the slippery slope of utter nonsense.

If you are sane enough to know of the idiotic nature of this community, get out of it right now, and find another, much more sane community to settle.

Edited November 23, 2014 by DJEN
Or, stay on our forum but skip to the next thread.

This thread needs to be gone. Why would one care for a probe from a out-to-date mod? Doing such an act is nonsensical and annoying, as if a troll came and swung its fur-tipped tail all over your monitor, damaging it beyond repair.

This, my friends on the internet, proves that the community of KSP has gone down the slippery slope of utter nonsense.

If you are sane enough to know of the idiotic nature of this community, get out of it right now, and find another, much more sane community to settle.

Shouldn't you get an infraction for posting flame bait? And if this is a sarcastic joke, it's not funny in any way.

Shouldn't you get an infraction for posting flame bait? And if this is a sarcastic joke, it's not funny in any way.

The Orbiting One is merciful.

:hailprobe:

Nice, it isn't dead yet?

Well then,

Ascensiam, tell us of the future from whence you came. Is the 22nd a century a utopia or dystopia?

:hailprobe:
There's no peace in the middle east, and the unsliceable bread was invented

Unsliceable bread? I'll stay in this century then.

*scraps time machine prototype*

:hailprobe:

How the hell did you join two years from now?

:hailprobe:
I am an ancient thing, from a time long since passed.

Ascensiam, tell us of the future from whence you came. Is the 22nd a century a utopia or dystopia?
There's no peace in the middle east, and the unsliceable bread was invented

But Half-Life 3 is about to hit the shelves in little less than a year!

Edited November 23, 2014 by Felsmak

This thread needs to be gone. Why would one care for a probe from a out-to-date mod? Doing such an act is nonsensical and annoying, as if a troll came and swung its fur-tipped tail all over your monitor, damaging it beyond repair.

This, my friends on the internet, proves that the community of KSP has gone down the slippery slope of utter nonsense.

If you are sane enough to know of the idiotic nature of this community, get out of it right now, and find another, much more sane community to settle.

Because it's Kerbal Space Program history. And a big "thank you" to the Orbiter community, they lifted this game of the ground in its starting days. And 'idiotic community'? I have never seen one gaming community that is more mature, friendly and helpful than this one.
:hailprobe:
